text:
Weeeeeeeell it might be the best as soon as we can get over this daaamn lockdown, as film productions stoped shooting the work is becoming scarce for VFX houses. It can be rewarding in a sense of accomplishment. When you finally get this awesome note from supe saying “Great! It’s a PAF (proposed as final).” 
It’s a nice thing to try big companies, so if in the end you’ll get a chance to be in one, take it as you can learn tons and they have programmes to develop your skill set in other areas too. Plus loads of artists to get to know and good massive parties :D.

Small companies are awesome too, your skill set will develop rapidly and you probably will end up doing loads of things in comp as there isn’t much of a budget for CG or it might look a bit like game model :). I found that smaller companies do less free overtime too and are more caring about their employees.
